title: How much can I charge as a beginner for writing a 250-300 word article? - Quora

response.answer_text: Q: How much can I charge as a beginner for writing a 250-300 word article? Depends on the type of article, niche, and client. The fact that you're a beginner is irrelevant. You can charge whatever you find a client willing to pay you. If your writing is competent and you're in a decent niche, you should be able to get a minimum of $30–60. (More like $300 is possible, but that's unlikely without clips, which are prior examples.) If you're pitching topics, you should be getting paid more than if they're providing topics. Have a written contract or at least a letter of agreement. As a tip, don't compete based on price. If you try to provide the cheapest rates, you'll attract a lot of unpleasant clients and sabotage client loyalty. Too-low rates also repel good clients.

There's no such rule of how much you can charge for an article But…you have to get you foot in the door first. Meaning you might have to show your work to a publisher or editor to hire you. And if they like your work they might let you write for them Writing articles for a living isca tough job…many writers that you see have been around for a long long time I wish you all the luck in the world…
